result.execSummary:
The defendant Allyson A Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentece Credit for 84 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your extended supervision/probation conditions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allyson A Edwards in court, in custody, with attorney Dennis P Coffey.    Sue Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Victim's mother makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. Attorney Coffey makes statements.   Court makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1  
Imposed Sentence of:        
3 1/2 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 84 days)  
1 1/2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your extended supervision / probation conditions
Restitution: $0
Cost: $268.00 Bail to be applied
DNA surcharge: $250.00 Bail to be applied
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2  
Imposed and stayed Sentence of:        
6 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days)  Consecutive to count #1.  
3 Years of Initial Confinement
3 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 years 

Conditions of Extended Supervision / Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of  illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
Inform agent of all prescriptions;
Disclose to any physician in writing your extended supervision / probation conditions
Restitution: $0
Cost: $268.00 Bail to be applied 
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Condition Time: 30 days jail, no huber. STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

***** Judgment of conviction to be amended, Count #1 is NOT consecutive to anything.  Count #2 remains consecutive to count #1.  Per Judge Ramirez on 6/17/2016***
filed by Attorney Coffey.

Defendant Allyson A Edwards in court, in custody, with attorney Dennis P Coffey.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed, a date on the amended information was amended in the courtroom.  Attorney Coffey acknowledges receipt of the amended information.  Defendant pleads no contest to amended counts #1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  Court schedules sentencing.  Neither party is requesting a PSI be done.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Bail revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
